data.title: Catholic Sat
data.meta_description: Posts about Fatima written by Thomas
data.text:
All times are UTC/GMT

Monday 6

06:30

Live from Castel Gandolfo, Italy. Holy Mass on the 34th Anniversary of the Death of Pope Paul VI, from the Parish Church of St. Thomas of Villanova. Presided by Bishop Marcello Semeraro, Bishop of Albano.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV2000

07:30

Live from Mount Tabor, Israel. Solemn Mass on the Feast of the Transfiguration of the Lord, from the Franciscan Basilica of the Transfiguration. Presided by Fr. Pierbattista Pizzaballa, Custos of the Holy Land.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV2000, Noursat

16:00

Live from Luboń, Poland. Holy Mass for the Radio Maryja Family Meeting on the Vigil of the Memorial of Blessed Edmund Bojanowski, founder of the Congregation of the Sister Servants of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary, from the Sanctuary of the Sister Servants of the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

Tuesday 7

16:30

Live from Anaheim, California, USA. Holy Mass, Votive of Our Lady of Guadalupe, for the Opening of the Knights of Columbus 130th Supreme Convention, from the Anaheim Hilton Hotel. Presided by Bishop Tod David Brown, Bishop of Orange.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

20:00

Live from Anaheim, California, USA. Opening Session of the Knights of Columbus 130th Supreme Convention, from the Anaheim Hilton Hotel.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

Wednesday 8

02:30

Live from Anaheim, California, USA. State’s Dinner at the Knights of Columbus 130th Supreme Convention, with the featured speaker Timothy Cardinal Dolan, Archbishop of New York, from the Anaheim Hilton Hotel.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

08:30

Papal General Audience

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN, Telepace, TV2000, TRSP, K-TV, TV TRWAM, KTO

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: EWTN (20:00), Canção Nova International (20:00), KTO (13:00, and again at 22:10)

11:30

Live from Wigratzbad, Germany. Holy Mass, Exposition of the Blessed Sacrament, and Blessing of the Sick, from the Seminary of Wigratzbad.

Channels Broadcasting Live: K-TV

Friday 10

04:00

Rebroadcast from Sweifieh, Amman, Jordan. Holy Mass for the 40th Anniversary of the Faith and Light Association Worldwide, and 20th of it in the region, from the Church of Our Lady of Nazareth. Presided by Archbishop Maroun Elias Nimeh Lahham, Titular Archbishop of Medaba, Auxiliary Bishop of Jerusalem, Patriarchal Vicar of Jordan.

Channels Broadcasting: Noursat

18:30

Live from Buffalo, New York, USA. Holy Mass of Installation of Richard Joseph Malone, as Bishop of Buffalo, from St. Joseph’s Cathedral.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

Saturday 11

09:00

Live from Zamość, Poland. Holy Mass of Installation of Marian Rojek, as Bishop of Zamość-Lubaczów, from the Cathedral of the Resurrection and St. Thomas the Apostle.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

Sunday 12

07:30

Live from Bzoummar, Lebanon. Divine Liturgy, in the Armenian Catholic Rite, with the Blessing of the Grapes Service, from Our Lady of Bzoummar Monastery. Presided by Patriarch Nerses Bedros XIX Tarmouni, Patriarch of Cilicia (Armenian).

Channels Broadcasting Live: Noursat

10:00

Papal Angelus

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, TV2000, K-TV, TV TRWAM, KTO, EWTN, TRSP

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: Padre Pio TV (11:40), KTO (11:50), Canção Nova (14:30)

18:00

Live from Lorena, São Paulo, Brazil. Holy Mass for the Priestly Ordination of Eder Pires de Brito and Egidio Pereira da Silva, for the Diocese of Lorena, from the Cathedral of Our Lady of Mercy. Presided by Bishop Benedito Beni dos Santos, Bishop of Lorena.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova

20:30

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Prayer Vigil, Procession, and Holy Mass for the August International and Migrant Pilgrimage. Blessing of the Candles and recitation of the Rosary in the Chapel of the Apparitions, followed by Candlelight Procession and finally celebration of Holy Mass. Presided by Bishop António Vitalino Fernandes Dantas, Bishop of Beja.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova International, Telepace, K-TV

Information on how to receive these channels can be found on our Channel Information Page. A list of links where the Channels can be viewed online can be found on our Live TV Links Page.

All times are UTC/GMT

Tuesday 10

04:00

Rebroadcast from Montreal, Canada. Divine Liturgy, in the Maronite Rite, presided by Patriarch Béchara Boutros Raï, Patriarch of Antioch and The Whole Levant (Maronite), on his recent Pastoral Visit to Mexico, Canada and the USA, from the Cathedral of St. Maron.

Channels Broadcasting: Noursat

Repeated: Tues. 22:00 (Noursat)

17:00

Live from Warsaw, Poland. Holy Mass for the intention of the victims of the Smolensk Air disaster, 27 months after the incident, from the St. John’s Archcathedral.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

Wednesday 11

11:30

Live from Wigratzbad, Germany. Holy Mass, Exposition of the Blessed Sacrament, and Blessing of the Sick, from the Seminary of Wigratzbad.

Channels Broadcasting Live: K-TV

16:00

Live from Castel Gandolfo, Italy. Concert in honour of Pope Benedict XVI, by the West-Eastern Divan Orchestra, consisting of musicians from Israel, Palestine, Syria, Jordan, Egypt, Lebanon, Iraq, Turkey and Spain, with the conductor Daniel Barenboim, in thecourtyard of the Apostolic Palace of Castel Gandolfo.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: TV2000 (20:00)

18:00

Live from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Requiem Mass for the Funeral of Eugênio Cardinal de Araújo Sales, Protopriest of the College of Cardinals and Archbishop Emeritus of São Sebastião do Rio de Janeiro, from the Metropolitan Cathedral of St. Sebastian. Presided by Archbishop Orani João Tempesta, Archbishop of São Sebastião do Rio de Janeiro.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova

Thursday 12

04:00

Rebroadcast from Halifax, Canada. Divine Liturgy, in the Maronite Rite, presided by Patriarch Béchara Boutros Raï, Patriarch of Antioch and The Whole Levant (Maronite), on his recent Pastoral Visit to Mexico, Canada and the USA, from the Church of Our Lady of Lebanon.

Channels Broadcasting: Noursat

20:30

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Prayer Vigil, Procession, and Holy Mass for the July International Pilgrimage. Blessing of the Candles and recitation of the Rosary in the Chapel of the Appariations, followed by Candle Light Procession and finally celebration of Holy Mass. Presided by Bishop Nuno Brás, Titular Bishop of Elvas, Auxiliary Bishop of Lisbon.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, Canção Nova International, K-TV

Friday 13

08:00

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Procession, Holy Mass and Blessing of the Sick for the July International Pilgrimage. Presided by Bishop Nuno Brás, Titular Bishop of Elvas, Auxiliary Bishop of Lisbon

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, Canção Nova International, K-TV

Sunday 15

06:00

Rebroadcast from Annaya, Lebanon. Divine Liturgy, in the Maronite Rite, on the Feast of St. Charbel, from St. Maron Monastery. Presided by Bishop Michel Aoun, Bishop of Jbeil {Byblos} (Maronite).

Channels Broadcasting: Noursat

07:30

Live from Frascati, Lazio, Italy. Pastoral Visit of Pope Benedict XVI to Frascati. Papal Mass from St. Peter’s Square, Frascati. Presided by Pope Benedict XVI

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, EWTN, TV2000, KTO, K-TV

10:00

Papal Angelus

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, TV2000, K-TV, TV TRWAM, KTO, EWTN, TRSP

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: Padre Pio TV (11:40), KTO (11:50), Canção Nova (14:30)

Information on how to receive these channels can be found on our Channel Information Page. A list of links where the Channels can be viewed online can be found on our Live TV Links Page.

All times are UTC/GMT

Monday 11

12:50

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Coverage of the 2nd Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, with theme of Gathering. Speakers include Br. Alois Löser Prior of the Taizé Community, France and Dr. Maria Voce, the President of Focolare.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

15:00

Live Baabdat, Lebanon. Holy Mass for the closing of the Diocesan process investigation for the Beatification of the Capuchin Martyrs Fr. Leonard Melki and Fr. Touma Saleh, from the Monastery of St. Anthony.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Noursat

17:30

Live from Rome, Italy. Convention of the Rome Diocese, from the Papal Archbasilica of St. John Lateran. Presided by Pope Benedict XVI

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, TV2000, KTO

Tuesday 12

12:50

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Coverage of the 3rd Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, with theme of ‘Communion in Marriage and Family’. Speakers include Archbishop Barry Hickey, Archbishop Emeritus of Perth, Australia and Dr. Carl Anderson, Supreme Knight, Knights of Columbus.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

15:00

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Holy Mass on the 3rd Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, from the Royal Dublin Society Arena. Presided by Andre Cardinal Vingt-Trois, Archbishop of Paris.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

16:00

Live from Gdańsk-Oliwa, Poland. Holy Mass on the occasion of the 25th Anniversary of the visit of Blessed Pope John Paul II to Gdańsk, and the 20th Anniversary of the founding of the Archdiocese of Gdańsk, from the Cathedral Basilica of the Most Holy Trinity. Presided by Tarcisio Cardinal Bertone, Secretary of State of the Vatican, Camerlengo of the Holy Roman Church.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

17:30

Live from Rome, Italy. Convention of the Rome Diocese, from the Papal Archbasilica of St. John Lateran. Presided by Agostino Cardinal Vallini, Vicar General of Rome, Archpriest of the Archbasilica of San Giovanni in Laterano.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace

20:30

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Prayer Vigil and Holy Mass for the June International Pilgrimage. Blessing of the Candles and Rosary in the Chapel of the Apparitions, followed by Candle Light Procession and finally celebration of Holy Mass. Presided by Bishop José Manuel Garcia Cordeiro, Bishop of Bragança-Miranda.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, Canção Nova, K-TV

Wednesday 13

08:00

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Procession, Holy Mass and Blessing of the Sick for the June International Pilgrimage. Presided by Bishop José Manuel Garcia Cordeiro, Bishop of Bragança-Miranda.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: Telepace (10:00), K-TV (10:00)

08:30

Papal General Audience

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN, Telepace, TV2000, TRSP, K-TV, TV TRWAM, KTO

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: EWTN (20:00), Canção Nova International (20:00), KTO (13:00, and again at 22:10)

11:30

Live from Wigratzbad, Germany. Holy Mass, Exposition of the Blessed Sacrament, and Blessing of the Sick, from the Seminary of Wigratzbad.

Channels Broadcasting Live: K-TV

12:50

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Coverage of the 4th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, with theme of ‘Priesthood and Ministry in the service of Communion’. Speakers include Archbishop John Michael Miller, Archbishop of Vancouver, Canada, and Noreen Carroll of Foxrock parish, Dublin Ireland.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

14:55

Live from Padua, Italy. Holy Mass on the Feast of St. Anthony of Padua, followed by the procession of the relics of St. Anthony of Padua, from the Basilica of St. Anthony. Preside by Fr. Gianni Cappelletto, Provincal Minister of the Order of Friars Minor Conventual.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace

15:00

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Holy Mass on the 4th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress and the Feast of St. Anthony of Padua, from the Royal Dublin Society Arena. Presided by Oscar Andrés Cardinal Rodríquez Maradiaga, Archbishop of Tegucigalpa, Honduras.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

20:00

Live from Toruń, Poland. Holy Mass on the Feast of St. Anthony of Padua, and the 75th Anniversary of the founding of the Parish of St. Anthony. Presided by Bishop Andrzej Suski, Bishop of Toruń.

Channels Broadcasting: TV TRWAM

Thursday 14

08:50

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Liturgy of Reconciliation at the 50th International Eucharistic Congress. Presided by Peter Cardinal Turkson, President of Pontifical Council for Justice and Peace

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

12:50

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Coverage of the 5th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, with theme of ‘Reconciliation in our Communion’. Speakers include Laurent Monsengwo Cardinal Pasinya, Archbishop of Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo, and Richard Moores of Children in Crossfire.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

15:00

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Holy Mass on the 5th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, from the Royal Dublin Society Arena. Presided by Seán Cardinal Brady, Archbishop of Armagh, Primate of All Ireland.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

Friday 15

07:00

K-TV Mass on the Feast of the Sacred Heart of Jesus

Channels Broadcasting Live: K-TV

09:00

Live from Tarnow, Poland. Holy Mass of Installation of Bishop Andrzeja Jeża, as Bishop of Tarnow, from the Cathedral Basilica of the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

10:00

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Holy Mass on the Feast of the Sacred Heart of Jesus, from the Basilica of the Most Holy Trinity. Presided by Bishop, Titular Bishop of Gaudiaba, Military Ordinariate of Ordinariato Castrense de Portugal.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova International

12:00

EWTN Mass on the Feast of the Sacred Heart of Jesus.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

12:50

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Coverage of the 6th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, with theme of ‘Communion in Suffering and Healing’. Speakers include Archbishop Bashar Matti Warda, Archbishop of Arbil (Chaldean), and Ms. Rose Busingye, Meeting Point , Kampala, Uganda. At 13:45 Recitation of the Rosary on the Annual Global Rosary Relay for Priests.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

13:30

Live from Irondale, Alabama, USA. Recitation of the Rosary on the Annual Global Rosary Relay for Priests, from the Chapel of Our Lady of the Angels.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

14:00

Live from Cologne, Germany. Holy Mass on the Feast of the Sacred Heart of Jesus, and Priestly Ordinations, from the Cathedral of Sts. Peter and Mary. Presided by Joachim Cardinal Meisner, Archbishop of Cologne.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN Katholisches

15:00

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Holy Mass and the Sacrament of the Anointing of the Sick, on the 6th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress and the Feast of the Sacred Heart of Jesus, from the Royal Dublin Society Arena. Presided by Archbishop Fouad Twal, Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

15:30

Live from San Giovanni Rotondo, Italy. Stations of the Cross, from Monte Castellano, on the 10th Anniversary of the Canonisation of Padre Pio of Pietrelcina. Presided by Archbishop Michele Castoro, Archbishop of Manfredonia-Vieste-San Giovanni Rotondo.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Padre Pio TV

19:00

Live from San Giovanni Rotondo, Italy. Orchestral performance entitled ‘Joannes Paulus Secundus’, on the 10th Anniversary of the Canonisation of Padre Pio of Pietrelcina, from the Pilgrimage Church of St. Pio of Pietrelcina.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Padre Pio TV

Saturday 16

08:30

Live from San Giovanni Rotondo, Italy. Holy Mass on the occasion of the 10th Anniversary of the Canonisation of Padre Pio of Pietrelcina, from the Pilgrimage Church of St. Pio of Pietrelcina. Presided by Tarcisio Cardinal Bertone, Secretary of State of the Vatican, Camerlengo of the Holy Roman Church.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Padre Pio TV

08:45

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Coverage of the 7th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, with theme of ‘Communion in the Word through Mary’. Speakers include Archbishop Luis Antonio Tagle, Archbishop of Manila, Philippines, and Prof. John Monaghan, Vice-President, Society of St. Vincent de Paul.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

09:00

Live from Gorzow Wielkopolski, Lubuskie, Poland. Holy Mass of Episcopal Ordination of Msgr. Tadeusz Lityński, as Titular Bishop of Cemerinianus, Auxiliary Bishop of Zielona Góra–Gorzów, from the Cathedral of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary. Principal Consecrator is Archbishop Celestino Migliore, Titular Archbishop of Canosa, and Apostolic Nuncio to Poland. With the co-consecrators Bishop Stefan Regmunt, Bishop of Zielona Gora-Gorzow; and Archbishop Andrzej Dziega, Archbishop of Szczecin-Kamien.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

11:00

Live from Dublin, Ireland. Holy Mass on the 6th Day of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress and the Feast of the Immaculate Heart of Mary, from the Royal Dublin Society Arena. Presided by Robert Cardinal Sarah, President of the Pontifical Council ‘Cor Unum’.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

16:00

Live from San Giovanni Rotondo, Italy. Meeting of Tarcisio Cardinal Bertone, Secretary of State of the Vatican, Camerlengo of the Holy Roman Church, with the sick of the Casa Sollievo della Sofferenza.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Padre Pio TV

18:30

Live from Lodi, Italy. Holy Mass on the occasion of Priestly Ordinations, from the Basilica Cathedral of S. Bassiano. Presided by Bishop Giuseppe Merisi, Bishop of Lodi.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace

Sunday 17

07:00

Live from Bkerké, Lebanon. Holy Mass, in the Maronite Rite, on Father’s Day, from the Bkerké Patriarchate. Presided by Patriarch Béchara Boutros Raï, Patriarch of Antioch and all The Levant (Maronite)

Channels Broadcasting Live: Noursat

08:30

Live from Zouk Mosbeh, Beirut, Lebanon. Holy Mass on the 14th Anniversary of the death of Fr. Antonios Tarabay, from the Monastery of Our Lady of Louaize.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Noursat

10:00

Papal Angelus

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, TV2000, K-TV, TV TRWAM, KTO, EWTN, TRSP

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: Padre Pio TV (11:40), KTO (11:50), Canção Nova (14:30)

11:45

Live from Dublin, Ireland. The Final Mass, Statio Orbis of the 50th International Eucharistic Congress, from Croke Park. Presided Marc Cardinal Ouellet, Prefect of the Congregation for Bishops, President of the Pontifical Commission for Latin America.

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN

Information on how to receive these channels can be found on our Channel Information Page. A list of links where the Channels can be viewed online can be found on our Live TV Links Page.

All times are UTC/GMT

Wednesday 9

08:30

Papal General Audience

Channels Broadcasting Live: EWTN, Telepace, TV2000, TRSP, K-TV, TV TRWAM, KTO

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: EWTN (20:00), Canção Nova International (20:00), KTO (13:00, and again at 22:10)

Thursday 10

17:00

Live from Warsaw, Poland. Holy Mass for the intention of the victims of the Smolensk Air disaster, 25 months after the incident, from the St. John’s Archcathedral.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV TRWAM

Friday 11

16:00

Live from Paul VI Audience Hall, Vatican City. Concert offered by President Giorgio Napolitano, President of Italy, on the occasion of the seventh anniversary of the Pontificate of Pope Benedict XVI. Pope Benedict XVI in attendance.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace

Saturday 12

07:30

Live from Rome, Italy. Holy Mass with the Pilgrimage Statue of Our Lady of Fatima, from the Santuario della Madonna del Divino Amore.

Channels Broadcasting Live: TV2000

20:30

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Prayer Vigil and Holy Mass on the Feast of Our Lady of Fatima, the May International Pilgrimage and the anniversary of the first apparition of Our Lady to the three Shepherd Children of Fatima. Presided by Gianfranco Cardinal Ravasi, President of the Pontifical Council for Culture, President of the Pontifical Commission for the Cultural Heritage of the Church, President of the Pontifical Commission for Sacred Archeology.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova International, Telepace, K-TV

Sunday 13

07:30

Live from Arezzo, Tuscany, Italy. Pastoral Visit of Pope Benedict XVI to Arezzo-La Verne-San Sepolcro. Holy Mass and recitation of the Regina Caeli, from the Parc Il Prato (The Meadow), presided by Pope Benedict XVI

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, EWTN, KTO, TV2000, K-TV

08:00

Live from Fatima, Portugal. Holy Mass and Blessing of the Sick on the Feast of Our Lady of Fatima, the May International Pilgrimage and anniversary of the first apparition of Our Lady to the three Shepherd Children of Fatima. Presided by Gianfranco Cardinal Ravasi, President of the Pontifical Council for Culture, President of the Pontifical Commission for the Cultural Heritage of the Church, President of the Pontifical Commission for Sacred Archeology.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Canção Nova International

Channels Broadcasting Delayed: Telepace (19:10)

14:30

Live from São Paulo, Brasil. Holy Mass in the Maronite Rite on the Feast of Our Lady of Fatima, from the Cathedral of Our Lady of Lebanon. Presided by Bishop Edgar Madi, Bishop of Nossa Senhora do Libano em São Paulo.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Noursat

15:30

Live from La Verna, Tuscany, Italy. Pastoral Visit of Pope Benedict XVI to Arezzo-La Verne-San Sepolcro. Visit of Pope Benedict XVI to the Shrine of La Verna, the Chapel of Stigmata, on the summit of Monte Penna where St. Francis received the stigmata.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, EWTN, KTO, TV2000, K-TV, TV TRWAM

17:15

Live from Sansepolcro, Tuscany, Italy. Pastoral Visit of Pope Benedict XVI to Arezzo-La Verne-San Sepolcro. Visit of Pope Benedict XVI to Sansepolcro, and the Co-Cathedral of St. John the Evangelist, which houses the crucifix of Santo Volto. Followed by a greeting to the people of Sansepolcro from the Piazza Torre di Berta.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace, EWTN, KTO, TV2000, K-TV, TV TRWAM

Information on how to receive these channels can be found on our Channel Information Page. A list of links where the Channels can be viewed online can be found on our Live TV Links Page.

All times are UTC/GMT

08:30

Papal General Audience

Blessing of the Candles and Rosary in the Chapel of the Apparitions, followed by Candle Light Procession and finally celebration of Holy Mass. Presided by Archbishop Paolo Pezzi, Archbishop of Mother of God at Moscow.

Live from Verona, Italy. Prayer Vigil with the Young People from the Cattedrale di Santa Maria Matricolare, Verona. Presided by Bishop Giuseppe Zenti, Bishop of Verona.

Channels Broadcasting Live: Telepace

14:00

Live from Paul VI Audience Hall, Vatican City. Meeting of Pope Benedict XVI and new evangelizers.

Live from St. Peter’s Basilca, Vatican City. Papal Mass for the New Evangelization. Presided by Pope Benedict XVI

09:00

Live from Przemyśl, Poland. Holy Mass on the occasion of the 25th Anniversary of the installation of Archbishop Józefa Michalika, as Archbishop of Przemyśl, from the Cathedral of St. John the Baptist and the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

Live from Wigratzbad, Bavaria, Germany. Holy Mass on the occasion of the 10th anniversary Military Pilgrimage. Music provided by Bundeswehrmusikzug Oberschwaben.

16:30

Live from Paris, France. Holy Mass from Notre Dame de Paris, on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the founding of Missionary Fraternity of Priests of the city of Paris.

Channels Broadcasting Live: KTO

Blessing of the Candles and Rosary in the Chapel of the Apparitions, followed by Candle Light Procession and finally celebration of Holy Mass. Live from Cosenza, Italy. Holy Mass for the beatification of Sr. Elena Aiello, founder of the order of the Little Sisters of the Passion of Our Lord Jesus Christ.

Live from Washington D.C, USA. Memorial Mass for Archbishop Pietro Sambi RIP, the Papal Nuncio to the United States, from the Basilica of the National Shrine of the Immaculate Conception. Presided by Archbishop Timothy Dolan, Archbishop of New York.

Live from Turin, Italy. Holy Mass for the Beatification of Fr. Francesco Paleari, from the Church of Piccola Casa della Divina Provvidenza. Presided by Angelo Cardinal Amato, Prefect of the Congregation for the Causes of Saints.

Live from Verona, Italy. Holy Mass on the 25th Anniversary of the Community of Regina Pacis.

Live from Bardo, Poland. Radio Maryja Family Meeting and Holy Mass from the Church of Our Lady, Guardian of the Faith. Presided by Bishop Ignacy Dec, Bishop of Świdnica.

Live from Verona, Italy. Holy Mass on the Feast of St. Clare, from the Monastery of Clarisse Sacramentine in Novaglie. Presided by Bishop Giuseppe Zenti, Bishop of Verona.

Friday 12
